markdownRemark.html:
Every Devâ€™s Doing It!

Blogging about their goals for 2019, of course!

I find that making goals works best for me, as they are more concrete than resolutions, which our friends at google claim, â€˜is â€œa firm decision to do or not to do somethingâ€â€™.

Seems to me then, that new yearâ€™s â€˜resolutionsâ€™ are something that can quickly be â€˜brokenâ€™, and thatâ€™s at the moment you go against your original â€˜decisionâ€™.

Goals are typically bigger in scope, and they are something to actively work towards, you canâ€™t really â€˜breakâ€™ your goal. I suppose you can just make no effort to work towards them, but then theyâ€™ll make you feel very guilty as they stare at you from their list ğŸ˜„.

So make goals for 2019! ğŸ˜‰

ğŸ™„ Okay, enough with the New Yearâ€™s philosophy alreadyâ€¦ ğŸ™„

Anyway, this year should be exciting in terms of goals, since Iâ€™m not bound to a fixed location of work for 42.5 hours a week. With that said, Iâ€™m still keen to be using the traditional 40 hours a week leftover outside of my parttime contract to develop my skills and continue building projects.

Goals for 2019

Iâ€™ve divided my goals into two halves: directly career-oriented goals and miscellaneous (mostly hobbies and )

Software Engineering and Career Goals

  • Learn Typescript and incorporate it into my personal stack of choice (As a first challenge, Iâ€™m going to convert this very blog to typescriptâ€¦ still keeping GatsbyJSâ€¦ I predict explosions and failure in my futureâ€¦ ğŸ˜­)
  • Find a paying freelance employer or project (in addition to what looks like a 60-80% time fixed contract for 2019. I should have the time for this)
  • Finally build a profitable side hustle! (Iâ€™m not sure if it will be a software product, a non-software product, or another shot at an e-commerce store. I suppose since itâ€™s a fresh start this year, I have to be honest with myself about Siren Apparel. The bottom line is that nobody visits the site! Iâ€™m going to deactivate our Shopify subscription this month and leave up the website as a boutique made-to-order store.)
  • Earn at least $1000 through my Skillshare course(s) (Iâ€™ve only got one up so far, but I have many planned in the pipeline. If itâ€™s more obviously I will be very happy!)

Miscellaneous Goals

  • Read more (I even made a â€˜read 30 booksâ€™ goal on goodreads.com - Iâ€™ll aim for that first, but honestly, it should be even more for all of 2019. This is the year where I will start properly keeping track of my books on goodreads.com as well.)
  • Paint more (I made a number of acrylic and watercolor pieces back in 2017, but 2018 was a very slow year in terms of physical pieces art. I published much more digital art in 2018.)
  • Record and publish at least 2 songs (Acquiring the bare minimum for a home studio was also new for me in 2018, at least in the last half of 2018. Iâ€™m learning just how hard recording and sounding with a professional microphone is. It will take practice and some good songwriting, but I am confident to release a few songs this year, more if there is time.)
  • Run a marathon (fitness itself was not a problem for me in 2018, I did some massive hikes in the summer, which is a kind of tradition for me, but I just couldnâ€™t find the time - or courage (?) - to go out and do one ğŸ˜‚)
  • More winter hiking/ski touring (this is a weird one, but I realized in all of 2018 I used my snowshoes twice for two winter hikesâ€¦ granted, I went skiing a lot as well last year, but, I mean, I live in Austria, there is really no excuse not to be out and about in the mountains on the weekend, including hiking!)
